ponents of Antenatal Check-up
I. History-taking
During the fi rst visit, a detailed history of the woman needs to be taken to:
(i) Confi  rm the pregnancy (fi rst visit only).
(ii) Identify whether there were complications during any previous pregnancy/confi nement 
that may have a bearing on the present one.
(iii) Identify any current medical/surgical or  obstetric condition(s) that may complicate 
the present pregnancy.
